wrapScienceJ.gui

Interface OpenImageDialog

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OpenImageDialogIJ

    public interface OpenImageDialog
    Allows to ask the user for an image path, with default; last opened, or a specified directory/file

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDefaultDirectory()
      Allows to prompt the user to choose a file from a dialog box.
      java.lang.String getLastDirectory()
      Allows to prompt the user to choose a file from a dialog box.
      java.lang.String getLastResortDirectory()
      Attempt to return a valid directory
      ImageCore openImage(java.lang.String dir)
      Allows to prompt the user to choose a file from a dialog box, specifying a directory.

    • Method Detail

      • openImage

        ImageCore openImage(java.lang.String dir)
        Allows to prompt the user to choose a file from a dialog box, specifying a directory. If the argument directory dir exists as a directory on the disk, then that directory is used to initialize the Open File Dialog. Otherwise, the default directory of the Framework is used.
        Parameters:
        dir - directory to choose an image from
        Returns:
        The image loaded after the path provided, null if cancelled

      • getDefaultDirectory

        java.lang.String getDefaultDirectory()
        Allows to prompt the user to choose a file from a dialog box. The default directory of the Framework is used to initialize the Open File Dialog.
        Returns:
        The image loaded after the path provided, null if cancelled

      • getLastDirectory

        java.lang.String getLastDirectory()
        Allows to prompt the user to choose a file from a dialog box. If the Last Used Directory is available in the Framework and exists as a directory on the disk, then that directory is used to initialize the Open File Dialog. The default directory of the Framework is used to initialize the Open File Dialog.
        Returns:
        The image loaded after the path provided, null if cancelled

      • getLastResortDirectory

        java.lang.String getLastResortDirectory()
        Attempt to return a valid directory
        Returns:
        A string representing a valid directory
